text: The visit went quite smoothly, the doctor checked the test results, conducted a substantive interview, and established a treatment plan. Additionally, he recommended tests for which he did not issue a referral (a doctor's referral is required to perform the test), even though he suggested it during the visit. Currently, contact with the doctor is quite limited, and I don't know if without scheduling a paid visit he will issue me a referral for the tests he recommended. From this side, it looks weak. Regards, Jan

The visit was quick, I was counting on something more than prescribing standard treatment, which she suggested. I thought I would get medications made that are also effective, or at least some care tips. In summary, I didn't learn anything new, and any doctor can prescribe medications suggested by the patient.

Optical methods for monitoring the brain utilize the fact that light can penetrate the skull bones to some extent. This especially concerns light from the near-infrared range, with wavelengths between 650 and 850 nanometers (a nanometer is one-millionth of a millimeter). The properties of blood are of significant importance here - specifically hemoglobin, whose oxygenated form interacts with light differently than the reduced form. This phenomenon allows assessing the oxygenation level of the observed body part by analyzing the intensity of light penetrating the tissue. The basic elements of optical diagnostic devices are small light sources (laser diodes) and sensitive photodetectors. The sources and detectors, usually spaced 2-5 cm apart, are paired together. Several to over a dozen such pairs can be applied to the patient's head simultaneously, potentially allowing examination of a significant part of the brain.

Today I was at my first visit. The professor's behavior is specific. After today's, I felt a bit like an intruder. I will try to go to the next one and see if I still have the same conviction. I'm not saying he isn't a great specialist. It's still hard for me to tell for now. I am not the type of person who wallows in self-pity, but I am just a patient. I have the right to ask questions. If I were a doctor in this specialty, it wouldn't be a problem. The visit was short, and the effect is such that "I know that I know nothing"...

We most prefer to eat vegetables and fruits raw or boiled, but preferences are quite diverse. Women more often than men choose relatively "exotic" ways of preparing vegetables and fruits: stewing (31% of women and 26% of men), steaming (28% of women and 19% of men), baking (24% of women and 15% of men), and grilling (24% of women and 12% of men). Also, women (77%) more often than men (69%) eat vegetables and fruits as standalone dishes, e.g., as snacks. An even greater disparity can be observed in the case of consuming vegetables and fruits as an addition to other dishes, e.g., in the form of a salad. As many as 88% of women and 75% of men consume them this way.

Innovative work on implementing a hybrid ultrasound tomograph for breast examination in women was co-financed by the National Centre for Research and Development, which supported it with a grant of PLN 6.9 million. As the NCBR press office informed PAP, this was support directed at entrepreneurs from the competition "Industrial research and development works carried out by enterprises" under the Intelligent Development Operational Programme. This is one of the main NCBR programmes aimed at entrepreneurs. Its innovative formula - limiting formalities to the necessary minimum, a phased call for proposals, and a short decision time (60 days) on funding - is very attractive for companies. NCBR awards funding for the implementation of R&D projects by entrepreneurs on a competitive basis, based on expert assessment - explained the NCBR press office.

We were at the doctor's with a recurring ear infection with perforation. He prescribed the same antibiotic that the child had already been given a week earlier. Unfortunately, after this treatment, there was another recurrence (another female doctor said that this antibiotic is too weak). As a person, the doctor is very nice.

Today was our first visit to the doctor with our 2-year-old son. The visit was express, so I didn't have time to ask a few questions, we got a referral for blood tests and allergy medication. And that's it, I hope next time, with a full set of tests, we will find out everything, and most importantly, how to help the child :-)

I do not recommend!! Unfortunately, I was treated by Dr. Anna Kowalska for 6 years, exactly since I was 18, because I had a problem with my period. I agree that she is very nice, has time, will tell you everything, but... For 6 years, she didn't tell me what was really wrong with me... She prescribed medications (hormones), I took them, sometimes it helped, sometimes not... the results with their interpretation varied... After these 6 years, I changed doctors and it turned out that I am suspected of ovarian failure (premature menopause) even though I am 24 years old!!!!! I definitely do not recommend, I only wasted my time and, above all, my... only I don't know if I will ever get this time back in any way...

I recommend and disagree with the previous opinion. I spent a week in the hospital in Lwówek and I could see that this doctor exceptionally treats patients well regardless of age and wealth. In my opinion, he cares for the patients' health as best as possible by visiting them, and not just superficially in the morning and evening, but he carefully monitors their health status. In my opinion, a very good surgeon performing his work with heart, caring for patients, and demanding engagement in work from the hospital staff.

Pani Anna Kowalska is a very positive and open person; more than once she surprised me with her views, which, however, were hard for me to agree with given my attitude towards life and character. However, she opened a door for me to better thinking about my life; I am on the path to changes, but with small steps :). I would like to feel better with myself and with my loved ones and start appreciating what they do for me and see that life can actually be joyful. To live instead of just exist. It's time to take care of myself. Thank you very much for the support : ) I already feel better thanks to this visit; it was not wasted time! I can recommend :D

At CePT, research is also conducted on the use of hyperpolarization technique to study tissue metabolism using magnetic resonance, sequencing tumors of the nervous system (which allows for more effective treatment), creating polymer implants for the reconstruction of blood vessels, bones, tendons, or cartilage using methods such as micro-spinning, or applying mass spectrometry to detect cancers. "The number of projects conducted using CePT infrastructure is more than three times higher (514) than planned (150), publications – four times higher, while the number of obtained patents – even 8 times, however, in the case of innovations implemented in enterprises, the plan was only realized in 48%" – admitted Prof. Jadwiga Turło - Vice-Rector for Science and Technology Transfer at the Medical University of Warsaw.

The doctor did not make a good impression on me. He was evidently in a hurry and just wanted to get the visit over with, even though it was private. I had a problem with my throat, and the doctor dismissed it, saying nothing was wrong with me. It's strange that a few days later I got even sicker... the only thing he did was suggest surgery to remove my tonsils. I went to another doctor and it turned out that the causes of the sore throat were elsewhere and my tonsils are perfectly fine. Additionally, he suggested surgery for a deviated septum, which I don't need because I don't have major breathing problems...

He diagnosed the pregnancy only in the 10th week; before that, he claimed I had cycle disorders and even wanted to prescribe medication to induce menstruation; fortunately, I did not decide to take it. As the doctor who first diagnosed the pregnancy, he entered the wrong (later) due date in my chart, even though I explained to him that it was absolutely impossible; I could have given the date and even the time of conception; later my husband went away. He joked that a husband is not needed to get pregnant. I gave birth at 43 weeks (42 weeks and 3 days), the labor lasted over a day, there was almost no amniotic fluid, the baby was not breathing on its own, they barely saved it. A nightmare.

The visit was very pleasant, the doctor conducted a thorough interview, we considered together the causes of the problem that arose in me, in order to eliminate the cause as effectively as possible. I hope the prescribed medications will help; if not - I will return to the doctor for another consultation. The only thing I could point out is more certainty in the doctor's stance; it would perhaps give the patient a sense of certainty in the medical diagnosis, although of course I am aware that health and medicine are not mathematics ;-). I recommend a visit to the doctor. Regards

This was my 2nd visit to Dr. Jan Kowalski. The doctor made a good impression on me with his calmness and professionalism. After the 1st visit and the prescribed medication, I felt a clear improvement and the knee pain subsided. I also got a handful of advice on what to do to make it hurt less. I am satisfied with this visit. I recommend.

I am six months post leg liposuction procedure. Unfortunately, my legs do not look good. The fat was not precisely removed; differences in the legs are visible; one is slimmer than the other; in some places I have indentations - where too much fat was taken, some areas (which were very important) were partially omitted, and next to the indentations I have bags of fat, which adds extra disproportion. Additionally, in the indented areas, I have dark spots on the skin; they look like dirty spots. The legs need correction.

Very weak is an understatement. This lady should not take on treating patients with myeloma!!!! She has no clue about it. It is sad and reprehensible to pretend to be a specialist in treating this very serious disease while using treatment methods that are 20 years behind. The doctor should inform the patient about various treatment methods, often offering a chance for longer life, and not apply palliative treatment to people who have a good chance for a transplant; moreover, with her treatment methods, she definitively closes the path to transplantation. Scandal, where is your conscience, doctor????!!!!!

Pani Anna is understanding and has time for the patient. She answers all questions, conducts a very thorough interview. I don't understand where so many negative opinions come from. I can recommend her and I certainly will not change to another doctor. I will add that I go under the National Health Fund.

Total ignorance towards the patient, no interview regarding clinical symptoms (referred by a dermatologist, and then an internist with suspected Lyme disease). Opinion solely based on serological tests (ELISA positive, WB negative), about which there are widespread opinions that their reliability is like a coin toss. To my question about what skin changes caused by a bite from a Lyme disease carrier look like, I heard that it's pointless for him to be interested in that, the most important thing is that the doctor is sure that my changes are not that. Another interesting fact, according to the doctor: Lyme disease is transmitted only and exclusively by ticks... I definitely do not recommend, a waste of time.
